title: Rajasthan govt. announces ‚Çπ10 lakh each to kin of children killed in Jhalawar school building collapse
content: CM Bhajan Lal Sharma also announced an increase from 15% to 20% in the permissible allocation for these buildings in the Dang, Magra and Mewat regions.

title: For five tribal settlements in Munnar, proper road is a distant dream
content: Children in the settlements are sent to hostels at the age of five so that they can attend schools. Those in need of medical care are carried on stretchers to hospitals in Marayur. People say a motorable road on a 13-km stretch would solve the problem, but blame the Forest dept. for hampering the project.

title: With groundwater turning saline and taps running dry, clean drinking water is a luxury at Pazhayar
content: TWAD Board supplies water to the village once in 10 days; officials say illegal drawal of water from the pipeline to the village is a major challenge and they are looking into it

title: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari to launch protest for ‚ÄòBengali Hindu homeland‚Äô, targets ‚Äòinfiltrators‚Äô
content: BJP Leader of Opposition alleges large-scale infiltration and voter list manipulation in West Bengal; calls for revision of electoral roll

title: Sigandoor temple trust seeks 4.19 hectares of forestland in sanctuary for its activities
content: Sigandoor temple trust claims it built guest houses, dining halls, and other structures on the forestland before it knew the land belonged to the Forest Department

title: 90 firearms, 728 ammunition, explosives seized from 5 districts of Manipur‚Äôs Imphal Valley
content: A senior police officer said that several of the seized firearms were reportedly looted from police armouries after ethnic conflict erupted in the State in May 202

title: Heavy rain, gusty winds lash central Travancore
content: Rain-related incidents reported in 54 villages across Kottayam, with 172 houses sustaining partial damage. Electricity supply remained disrupted at many locations. Two relief camps opened in Kottayam, three in Thiruvalla, Pathanamthitta.

title: Cast-off capital
content: ¬†Over the past two decades Panipat, a city in Haryana known in Indian history for three major battles, has emerged as one of Asia‚Äôs largest processors of textile waste. Ashok Kumar finds that the city has a large number of illegal bleaching and dyeing units, essential in the conversion of scrap cloth into low-quality thread. These units discharge contaminated water into drains that merge with the Yamuna river

title: Shashi Tharoor draws praise from Church
content: The praise from Syro-Malabar Catholic Church bishops at the platinum jubilee celebrations of the Pala diocese was all the more striking given that it came in the presence of KPCC  president Sunny Joseph.

title: HRW has highlighted illegal deportation of Bengali-speaking people, says Mamata
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee takes to social media and said the Human Rights Watch has released a report saying Bengali-speaking Indians are being abused and pushed out in a concerted manner by the BJP establishment

title: Mandatory to conduct audit of safety in schools: Govt tells states, UTs
content: ‚ÄúStructural integrity, along with fire safety, emergency exits, and electrical wiring, must be thoroughly assessed,‚Äù a senior MoE official said

title: Deadlock over Aranmula Vallasadya deepens as PSS threatens protests
content: Palliyoda Seva Sangham has objected to the move to hold the event inside the temple premises; terms it a serious violation of the temple‚Äôs traditions and rituals

title: Arambai Tenggol Backs Manipur Government Move To Check Illegal Entry To State
content: Meitei socio-political organisation Arambai Tenggol (AT) on Friday announced its full support to Manipur government's recent directive to tighten border security and prevent illegal entry into the state.

title: Supreme Court To Hear Plea Of Judge In Cash Row On July 28
content: The Supreme Court is scheduled to hear on Monday Allahabad High Court judge Yashwant Varma's plea seeking invalidation of a report by an in-house inquiry panel which found him guilty of misconduct in the cash discovery row.

title: Exclusive: Blank Papers, Multiple Credits - Manipur's Multi-Crore Highway Compensation Mystery
content: People affected by three ongoing highway widening projects in Manipur's Kangpokpi district have alleged an insurgent group forced them to sign on blank papers to take a cut from their compensation money.

title: How Will Legal Lifeline For Soldiers Work? Supreme Court Judge Explains
content: Soldiers brave everything from harsh terrain to enemy fire to protect the country, and the judiciary wants to ensure it can do everything possible for them and their families, Supreme Court judge Justice Surya Kant has said.

title: Ahmedabad Crash: Air India Pays Interim Compensation To 166 Victims' Families
content: Private carrier Air India on Saturday said it has paid the interim compensation to the families of 166 victims of the Ahmedabad plane crash last month.

title: Long-Range Drones Damaged Russian Electronic Warfare Equipment Plant: Ukraine
content: Ukrainian drones hit a radio and electronic warfare equipment plant in Russia's Stavropol region in an overnight attack on Saturday.

title: In U-Turn, Pak Minister Says "No Objection" To Terror Group Tag For TRF
content: Last week, Pakistan Foreign Minister Mohammad Ishaq Dar openly defended TRF after the US designated TRF as a Foreign Terrorist Organisation. In a significant shift, Dar backed the US' decision to label it as a "terrorist organisation".

title: Maldives President Praises Ties with India, Calls PM Modi "Wonderful Person"
content: Hailing ties with India, Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu on Saturday lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi's landmark two-day visit to the country, asserting that it has given a major boost to the bilateral ties between the two neighbours.

title: Keir Starmer Outlines UK's Efforts For Gaza Aid Airdrops, Child Evacuations
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Saturday spoke to his French and German counterparts and outlined UK plans to get aid to people in Gaza and evacuate sick and injured children, his office said.

title: 'From Drug Dealer To Martyr': 2 J&K Cops Suspended For Killing Tribal Man
content: Two policemen have been suspended after killing a tribal man in an alleged staged encounter in Jammu and Kashmir. The killing of Mohammad Parvaz sparked widespread protests and outrage in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Truck Loses Control On Mumbai-Pune Expressway, Rams 20 Cars
content: A major accident happened on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway near Khopoli in Raigad district, involving around 20 vehicles.

title: Suspect Arrested 13 Days After Girl, 10, Sexually Assaulted In Tamil Nadu
content: Thirteen days after the sexual assault of a 10-year-old girl in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvallur district, police have arrested the suspect, identified as Biswakarma, a migrant worker from Assam.

title: PM Modi Joins Maldives' Independence Day Celebrations As Chief Guest
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday graced the Independence Day celebrations of the Maldives as the guest of honour, in yet another signal of a turnaround in bilateral ties after a spell of unease.

title: Siddaramaiah Has Done More For Mysuru Than Iconic King Krishnaraja Wodeyar: Son
content: Even as talk of a leadership change in Karnataka is yet to completely die down, Congress Member of Legislative Council and Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's son Yathindra Siddaramaiah has given his father a huge endorsement.

title: On CCTV, Masked Robbers With Guns Drawn Loot Bengaluru Jewellery Store
content: In what looked like a scene straight out of a movie, three masked men stormed into a jewellery store just before closing time and made away with a quantity of gold in Bengaluru.

title: On CCTV, Masked Robbers With Guns Drawn Loot Bengaluru Jewellery Store
content: In what looked like a scene straight out of a movie, three masked men stormed into a jewellery store just before closing time and made away with a quantity of gold in Bengaluru.

title: Security Forces Recover 90 Arms, 728 Different Types Of Ammunition In Manipur
content: In a significant development, the security forces in joint operation have recovered 90 arms and around 728 different types of ammunition in restive Manipur, an official said on Saturday.

title: "One Of The Craziest Moments Of My Life": Akhil Patel On Serving Chai To PM Modi And Starmer
content: Indian-origin tea entrepreneur Akhil Patel recounted his experience of serving tea to Narendra Modi and Keir Starmer at Chequers, calling it a ‚Äúsurreal‚Äù moment.

title: "Wish God Had...": Mother Who Lost Both Children In Rajasthan School Tragedy
content: Just days ago, the cheerful laughter of two siblings echoed through the courtyard of a modest house in Rajasthan's Jhalawar.

content: The MP from Hajipur, and Union Minister of Food Processing Industries, accused the State government, of which he is an alliance partner, of ‚Äòeither trying to hush up the situation or being unable to handle it any more‚Äô

title: Congress accuses the government of doing ‚Äòpetty politics‚Äô over the motion to remove Justice Yashwant Varma
content: The party quotes former Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar‚Äôs July 21 statement to argue that the notice, signed by 63 Opposition members, had been admitted by the Chair, after reports claim that the Opposition-backed notice had not been admitted in the Upper House

title: 4 Maoists killed in encounter with security personnel in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
content: A huge quantity of weapons, including INSAS and SLR rifles, has been recovered from the spot, say police

title: 20 students fall ill due to suspected water contamination at Neravada
content: Of the 20, four are being treated at the Government Hospital in Panyam, while the remaining students were provided medical care at the Tribal Boys Residential School hostel itself

content: CJI B.R. Gavai‚Äôs willingness to judicially examine the question of Justice Varma‚Äôs¬†removal comes days after the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha members initiated a removal motion and submitted notices on the same

title: Govindachamy alleges drug, liquor trade inside Kannur Central Jail
content: He says he got no help in the jailbreak, admits to smoking ganja-laced beedi on the eve of the escape

title: Tamil Nadu Green Energy Corporation applies for intra-State electricity trading licence
content: It will engage in power trading through medium- and long-term contracts with simultaneous power purchase agreement and power sale agreement with the renewable power developer and Tamil Nadu Power Distribution Corporation Limited respectively

title: Shipbuilding cluster at Dugarajapatnam to give fillip to A.P.‚Äôs maritime sector
content: Currently, most of the commercial shipbuilding and repairs in the world are being done by the Japanese and Koreans, with companies such as Imabari Shipbuilding Co. Ltd, Hyundai and Kawasaki Shipbuilding Corporation being the dominant players

content: The upcoming NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar (NISAR) mission on July 30 was testimony to India‚Äôs growing stature in space technology, says V. Narayanan

content: Earlier, Prime Minister Narenddra Modi was warmly welcomed at the iconic Republic Square, where he graced the Independence Day celebrations of the Maldives as the guest of honour.

title: Kerala needs to support transplant patients for immunosuppressive therapy
content: As families with limited means are unable to bear the huge financial cost of post-transplant care, the State government must step in with financial support. Non-adherence to immunosuppressive therapy is becoming the single most cause of poor transplant outcome and organ rejection, say experts.

title: Governor approves ‚Çπ5,000 crore KKRDB action plan for 2025‚Äì26
content: Jewargi MLA and KKRDB chairperson Ajay Singh, who released a press note on Thursday, said the approval came in the third week of July after Chief Minister Siddaramaiah submitted the plan for the Governor‚Äôs assent

content: All pending works in hostels and classrooms must be completed with quality and within the stipulated timeframe, says Collector

title: Crime rate in Satya Sai district down by 27%, says SP

content: Representation made on behalf of FMG interns highlights how these medicos, who cleared the mandatory Foreign Medical Graduate Examination, are being pushed to the margins despite their contribution to the State‚Äôs healthcare system

content: According to the report, prior to intervention, the IRR corridor was plagued with congestion, missing footpaths, unlit stretches, poorly maintained stormwater drains, and inadequate bus frequency

content: The health of countless patients, predominantly children, had been compromised by the ingestion of medicines with dangerously high levels of toxic chemicals, the report said

title: Let us provide children with a nurturing environment, says judge at book launch on child protection laws in Ballari
content: Children are akin to divine beings. We must provide a safe and nurturing environment in houses, schools, and neighbourhoods to help them thrive., says judge

title: Yankees' Judge out vs. Phillies with 'elbow issue'
content: Yankees slugger Aaron Judge is not in the lineup for Saturday's game against the Phillies due to an "elbow issue," manager Aaron Boone said before the game.

title: Dolphins sign CB Jones after Burns' ACL injury
content: The Dolphins have signed free agent cornerback Jack Jones, making the move in the wake of Artie Burns tearing his ACL.

title: Miami: Messi 'extremely upset' with MLS over ban
content: Inter Miami co-owner Jorge Mas said Lionel Messi is "extremely upset" after being given a one-game suspension by MLS for skipping the All-Star Game.

title: Jets QB Fields joins drills days after toe injury
content: Justin Fields took part in quarterback and 7-on-7 drills at Jets training camp Saturday, two days after suffering a dislocated toe.

content: Paul Goldschmidt's off-balance throw was the Yankees' ninth error in four games as another loss dropped them 5¬Ω games back in the AL East.

title: VA Tech probing tampering claim by NC Central
content: Virginia Tech says it is looking into a tampering claim made by NC Central coach Trei Oliver, who says a Hokies' assistant attended an Eagles game in an effort to recruit their star running back.

title: A's Kurtz becomes first rookie with 4-HR game
content: Nick Kurtz of the Athletics became the first rookie in MLB history to hit four home runs in a game, doing so in a 15-3 victory over the Astros. He also had six hits and 19 total bases.

title: Back in Phoenix, Bonner doesn't regret 'journey'
content: DeWanna Bonner is happy to be back home in Phoenix after rejoining the team following a brief stint with the Fever. "I wouldn't do anything differently," she said.

content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: Rare earth supply risk: Indian firms flag Chinese curbs; can Beijing afford ban?
content: Indian electronics manufacturers are facing challenges in meeting production targets under the ECMS due to rare earth mineral shortages caused by Chinese export restrictions. Companies have raised concerns with MeitY, seeking leniency and exploring alternative sourcing. While the government considers extending the application window, the industry remains hopeful for a resolution to the supply chain disruptions.

title: Mumbai-Pune eway crash: 1 dead, 18 hurt as truck rams 20 vehicles
content: A high-speed container trailer truck, suspected to have suffered brake failure, caused a major pile-up on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway near the Adoshi tunnel. The incident involved approximately 20 vehicles, including luxury cars, resulting in one woman's death and injuries to at least 18 others.

title: JD Vance on Al taking jobs: If robots are coming for our jobs, you would...
content: US Vice President JD Vance dismisses fears of AI-driven mass unemployment, asserting that current labor market trends don't support such claims. Speaking at the AI Action Summit in Paris, Vance argued that AI will augment human labor, boosting productivity and creating new job opportunities.

title: India-US trade deal: Piyush Goyal shares important update on negotiations
content: Commerce minister Piyush Goyal announced that trade agreement talks with the US are progressing rapidly, with the next negotiation round scheduled for August in India. Both nations aim to finalize the initial agreement tranche by fall, targeting a significant boost to bilateral trade from $191 billion to $500 billion.

title: Asia Cup: India, Pakistan placed in same group; to face off on Sept 14 - complete fixtures
content: The 2025 Men's T20 Asia Cup will be held in the UAE from September 9-28, featuring eight teams, the largest edition yet. Arch-rivals India and Pakistan are in the same group and will clash on September 14. India's group stage includes matches against UAE and Oman. The tournament serves as preparation for the 2026 T20 World Cup.

title: Jeff Bezos sells $1.5 billion worth of Amazon shares, holds stock valued at...
content: Jeff Bezos recently sold 6.6 million Amazon shares worth $1.5 billion, as per an SEC filing. The sales occurred on July 21 and 22, before Amazon's Q2 earnings report. These transactions were executed under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Bezos intends to sell more shares, potentially up to 25 million by May 2026. He has already sold $4.

title: Chess | WC Final: Divya lets advantage slip, holds Humpy to draw
content: The first game of the Women‚Äôs Chess World Cup final saw a draw between Divya Deshmukh and Koneru Humpy in Batumi. Divya, playing white, surprised with a new opening, while Humpy's experience ensured a balanced game. Despite tense moments and repeated checks, neither player could break through, setting the stage for a gripping contest.

title: 'Saiyaara‚Äô BO collection day 9 (Live): Mohit Suri‚Äôs film set to cross Rs 200cr?
content: Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara,' starring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is a box office sensation, poised to cross Rs 200 crore on its second Saturday. The film's strong emotional narrative and music have resonated with audiences, propelling it into the Top 50 Hindi films. Akshay Kumar praised the film, highlighting the success of fresh talent in Bollywood.

title: OpenAI CEO says Al can diagnose better than many human doctors: ‚ÄòI am like ‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman stated that AI, like ChatGPT, often surpasses human doctors in diagnostic accuracy. Despite this, people still prefer human doctors, highlighting the importance of trust in healthcare. Altman also warned about an impending fraud crisis due to AI's ability to mimic voices, rendering current voice authentication methods obsolete.

title: Affair & poisoning: How missing bottle cap exposed 'suicide' as murder; wife, lover held
content: Initially appearing as a suicide near Kanva dam, the death of Lokesh Kumar, a former gram panchayat president, was cleverly disguised. However, observant police officers noticed missing details like the poison bottle cap and a missing slipper, raising suspicions.

title: Cash recovery row: SC to hear Justice Varma's plea against impeachment
content: The Supreme Court will hear Justice Yashwant Varma's petition on July 28, challenging an inquiry committee's findings and a recommendation for his impeachment. The controversy arose after a fire at his Delhi residence led to the discovery of a large sum of cash.

title: Students to learn about Op Sindoor‚Äôs military triumph in new NCERT module
content: NCERT is developing an educational module on ‚ÄòOperation Sindoor‚Äô to educate schoolchildren about India's military capabilities and technological advancements. The module, designed for Classes 3 to 12, will highlight India's defence readiness, scientific progress, and growing global stature. It will also cover themes like Mission LiFE, the Partition's horrors, and India's space achievements, including Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's ISS visit.

title: NHL players acquitted in sexual assault case: probe on; team undecided on next steps
content: Despite the acquittal of Michael McLeod, Carter Hart, Dillon Dube, Cal Foote, and Alex Formenton in a 2018 sexual assault case, the NHL has maintained their suspension, sparking conflict with the NHL Players Association. The league stated the players remain ineligible pending a review of the judge's findings, citing disturbing allegations even if not criminal.

title: 'Ashamed to support Bihar govt': Chirag Paswan flays NDA ally Nitish over rising crime
content: LJP (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan has criticized Bihar CM Nitish Kumar over the state's deteriorating law and order situation, even while his party remains a part of the NDA. Paswan's remarks follow a series of high-profile crimes in Bihar, leading the opposition to highlight potential rifts within the ruling alliance.

title: Cops bust int'l cartel run on delivery app model; gang used women as carriers
content: Delhi Police cracked down on a significant drug trafficking operation. They seized drugs worth over Rs 100 crore. Five foreign nationals got arrested. The syndicate operated across multiple countries. It used encrypted channels and forged documents. The police recovered cocaine, MDMA, and OG ganja. The investigation revealed a complex money laundering scheme. Authorities are further investigating the network.

title: Easier path to Green Card? US lawmaker to table bill in Senate soon - but will it pass?
content: Senator Alex Padilla is set to introduce a bill offering a green card pathway to immigrants who have resided in the US for at least seven years, have no criminal record, and meet other requirements. This initiative aims to update the Immigration and Nationality Act, potentially benefiting over 8 million people, including Dreamers and skilled workers facing green card backlogs.

title: Mumbai mishap: Car plunges into ditch after driver follows Google Maps; rescued
content: In Navi Mumbai's Belapur, a woman driving an Audi was rescued early Friday after her car plunged into a ditch around 1:00 am. She was reportedly following Google Maps directions when she took a wrong turn under a bridge, leading her into the water.

title: Top 5 entertainment news of the day: Hera Pheri 3 back on track & more
content: Sandeep Reddy Vanga regrets cutting emotional scenes from 'Animal,' while Akshay Kumar confirms 'Hera Pheri 3' is back with the original cast. Ekta Kapoor distances herself from the banned OTT platform ALTT, clarifying her departure in 2021. Amidst Saiyaara‚Äôs success, Aneet Padda denies nepotism claims, and Farah Khan seemingly critiques Deepika Padukone's demand for shorter work shifts.

title: Low insurance costs, affordable treatment and medicines drawing NRIs to India
content: A Policybazaar report reveals a surge in NRIs seeking medical treatment in India, driven by significantly lower costs. Health insurance purchases by NRIs have jumped 150% in 2024-25. Treatment costs in India can be 60-90% less than in the US, with heart bypass surgery costing Rs 4.5-8 lakh compared to Rs 60 lakh-1.3 crore in the US.

title: Bihar: Woman faints during home guard recruitment drive; 'gang-raped' inside ambulance
content: A shocking incident occurred in Gaya district, Bihar. A 26-year-old woman reported a gang-rape. The crime allegedly happened in a moving ambulance. She collapsed during a Home Guard recruitment drive. The incident took place on July 24th. Police arrested two men swiftly after receiving the complaint. An investigation is currently underway.

title: Michael Pezzetta wins over Maple Leafs fans with surprise visit to Youth Hockey camp
content: Michael Pezzetta, a Toronto native, has signed a two-year, $1.625 million deal with the Maple Leafs, adding physicality to their bottom-six. He recently engaged with young fans at the Maple Leafs youth hockey camp, demonstrating his commitment to the community. Pezzetta's return home brings excitement to his family and friends, all avid Leafs supporters.

title: Josh Allen reacts: Sister‚Äôs baby line drops with No. 17 twist ‚Äî Bills fans gush online
content: Josh Allen's sister, Nicala Madden, launched a baby clothing line called Little Dreamers Co., featuring a special collection named "17 Sideline Snuggles" as a tribute to Allen's jersey number. The Buffalo Bills quarterback expressed his pride and support for his sister's new venture.

title: Asia Cup 2025 schedule: Complete fixtures, India vs Pakistan date out
content: The 2025 Asia Cup is officially scheduled to take place in the United Arab Emirates from September 9th to 28th. The announcement was made by the Pakistan Cricket Board chairman on social media, promising a 'spectacular display of cricket'. Cricket enthusiasts can anticipate the release of the detailed schedule, including specific venues and fixtures, in the near future.

title: Uttarakhand: Landslide blocks Kedarnath route near Gaurikund; pilgrims halted
content: The trekking route to Kedarnath Dham, near Gaurikund, has been closed due to a landslide triggered by a hillock collapse on Friday night. The Public Works Department is working to clear the debris and restore the path. Security personnel are assisting pilgrims returning from Kedarnath, while those heading towards the shrine from Gaurikund have been stopped.

title: Prada-Kolhapuri row: Piyush Goyal says India will get due credit for its design
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal announced that India will receive due recognition for its unique cultural products under the new FTA with the UK, citing the Prada-Kolhapuri chappal controversy. The government aims to protect and promote Indian GI products in global markets, with potential for significant international business.

title: Piyush Goyal lauds India-UK FTA; calls it 'stepping stone towards Viksit Bharat'
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the newly signed India-UK FTA as a "game-changing" agreement, offering significant opportunities for Indian farmers, businesses, and youth. The comprehensive FTA, awaiting UK Parliamentary approval, aims to eliminate duties on 99% of Indian exports to the UK.

title: 'Manifests savarn and shudras': MP HC flags 'caste system' in judiciary
content: ‚Äã‚ÄãThe court also criticised what it described as a "caste system" within the judicial setup, where high court judges are seen as "savarn" and district judges as "shudras" and "les mis√©rables."

title: IND vs ENG: Jagadeesan gets visa, will leave tomorrow as Pant's injury cover
content: Narayan Jagadeesan is set to join the India squad in England as cover for the injured Rishabh Pant, who fractured his toe. Despite competition from other players, Jagadeesan's consistent performance and strong mental fortitude earned him the call-up. His coach highlights his discipline and process-oriented approach, while the Indian team grapples with multiple injury concerns during the ongoing tour.

title: EU sanctions on Russia oil: Indian arm of UAE-based shipping company takes a hit
content: The EU has imposed sanctions on Intershipping Services Hub, an Indian subsidiary of a UAE-based firm, and Captain Abhinav Kamal for allegedly aiding Russian oil trade. These sanctions, limited to EU entities, freeze European assets and restrict business dealings.

title: Mohit Suri‚Äôs ‚ÄòSaiyaara‚Äô becomes 2025‚Äôs second-biggest hit, beats 'Housefull 5'
content: Mohit Suri's Saiyaara is a box office hit. The film stars Ahaan Pandya and Aneet Padda. Saiyaara has earned Rs 190.25 crore in just eight days. It surpassed Housefull 5 collections. Experts predict a Rs 250 crore lifetime run. The film's success continues due to postponed releases. Saiyaara's second Friday earned Rs 17.50 crore.

title: 'Forever indebted': Tributes pour in from cricketers, IPL teams on Kargil Vijay Diwas
content: India commemorated the anniversary of Kargil Vijay Diwas, honouring the Indian armed forces' bravery and victory in the 1999 Kargil War. Former cricketers like Sachin Tendulkar and VVS Laxman, along with IPL teams such as Chennai Super Kings and Mumbai Indians, paid tribute to the soldiers' sacrifices on social media.

title: Kiss cam scandal: Astronomer teams up with Chris Martin's ex-wife Gwyneth Paltrow
content: Following a viral kiss cam incident involving its CEO and HR head at a Coldplay concert, tech company Astronomer has hired Gwyneth Paltrow as a temporary spokesperson. Paltrow's appearance in a promotional video aims to deflect attention from the scandal with humor. The company hopes to leverage the unexpected publicity, despite mixed reactions to the PR stunt.

title: Happy Hariyali Teej 2025 top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes
content: Hariyali Teej is a beautiful reminder of resilience, devotion, and the power of love. To honour the sacred bond of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati, fill your day with captivating messages, wishes, and quotes that spread joy, love, and sheer blessings.

title: ‚ÄòOBCs will have to think ...‚Äô: Cong leader likens Rahul to Ambedkar; BJP slams comparison
content: The BJP has intensified its criticism of Congress following Udit Raj's statement suggesting Rahul Gandhi could become a "second Ambedkar" with OBC support. Amit Malviya accused Congress of plotting to diminish Ambedkar's legacy, while Rahul Gandhi acknowledged his past failure to protect the OBC community and pledged to rectify it with a caste census.

title: 'Teams win because of combinations, not ...': Sidhu slams Gambhir's tactics
content: Former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu has strongly criticised Gautam Gambhir's team selection strategy during the ongoing Test series against England, particularly in the fourth Test. Sidhu expressed frustration over the frequent changes in the team composition, which he believes has disrupted the team's rhythm and hindered their ability to perform collectively.

title: India-UK trade deal: States, sectors set to gain from tariff cuts- see list
content: India and the UK are signing a trade agreement. This deal will remove tariffs and make trade easier. Maharashtra will export more engineering goods and medicines. Gujarat will see growth in pharma and seafood exports. Tamil Nadu's textile and leather industries will benefit. Other states like Andhra Pradesh and Punjab will also experience export growth.
